Class UiColors

java.lang.Object
cat.dam.roig.cleanstream.ui.UiColors
public class UiColors extends Object
Common UI colors used across CleanStream components.

This class provides a small shared palette for semantic colors, intended to be reused in dialogs, labels, status messages and buttons.

Difference vs AppTheme:

  • AppTheme defines the global application theme (background, card, text, primary...)
  • UiColors defines semantic feedback colors (success, error, warning, neutral)

Usage examples:

  • label.setForeground(UiColors.ERROR); for error messages
  • label.setForeground(UiColors.SUCCESS); for success confirmations

Note: This class currently has a public constructor (implicit). If you want it to behave like a pure utility holder (recommended), make it final and add a private constructor. (Not changing it here to keep your file minimal.)

Author:
metku

  • Field Details

    • PRIMARY

      public static final Color PRIMARY
      Primary accent color (blue). Should match the primary action color of the theme.

    • ERROR

      public static final Color ERROR
      Error color (red). Used for validation errors and destructive actions.

    • CAREFULL

      public static final Color CAREFULL
      Warning/caution color (orange). Used for non-fatal warnings or attention states.

    • SUCCESS

      public static final Color SUCCESS
      Success color (green). Used for successful operations and confirmations.

    • NEUTRAL

      public static final Color NEUTRAL
      Neutral color (light gray). Used for secondary UI states or neutral messages.
